body:
Hi,
I'm willing to contribute to this enhancement. I'll contribute to both UI and python server implementation. Below is the mocked screen for this enhancement. Min/Max values are calculated across the epochs for any particular run. 

![MinMaxFR](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19736733/131241756-391dea21-4cd0-4ed0-8095-2d65a7f1461f.png)

@dannyfriar please confirm if this enhancement is correctly aligned with the proposed solution.

Hi @niksbansode

Thanks for picking this up. This is aligned with what I was thinking although it would be good to see the min, max and latest (as is shown now) value of the metric in the table from your screenshot above.

Possibly as a follow-up but I think it would be useful to have an option to display either the min, max or latest in the table of experiment runs too. E.g. in the screenshot below, this is showing the latest value of `test_mse`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10010084/131465191-ce460848-aa1d-416c-bbc2-141557ec4391.png)

Hi @dannyfriar @niksbansode @adamreeve. Apologies for the delayed response. I think we can leverage the existing GetMetricHistory API (https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/rest-api.html#get-metric-history) to implement this feature in the UI. This will require the frontend to scan the values of each metric and determine the min / max, but it should be much easier to implement than extending the `Metric` or `RunData` API, which is a major hurdle considering the number of organizations that implement their own MLflow Tracking services.

We'd be happy to review a pull request that implements this capability on the Runs page, as shown in the awesome mock provided by @niksbansode. In addition to Min & Max, we'd also want to display "Latest" (ideally, "Latest" would be displayed in the leftmost column).

Hi @dbczumar, computing the min and max on the UI side seems reasonable for the single run view, but showing the min/max values in the experiment view for multiple runs and potentially being able to sort and search based on the min/max values seems more useful, eg. to allow easily comparing runs, and that would probably require server side support.

I would think it should be possible to do this in a backwards compatible way, so that if a tracking API doesn't provide the min and max values then the UI just won't show them and won't allow sorting/searching by them (or maybe only show them in the single run view by falling back to the GetMetricHistory API).

I'd be happy to implement this in the single run view with min/max computation on the UI side as a starting point, but it would be great if there was a plan for how this can be supported in the experiment view too.

Absolutely, I agree that comparing and sorting runs based on min / max metric values would be quite helpful. I think it would be great to take incremental steps toward a solution, beginning with UIs for display min / max metric values for a single run. The next step we could take would be to display this information on the Compare Run page. After those, we can then work together to determine whether we want to update additional UIs (e.g. the runs table on the experiment page) or introduce expanded search support (e.g. including MIN / MAX clauses in the filter / order by strings).
